column1: #text=I had finished reading a very good book , and wanted to get a new one to read .
#text=I went to the library in my town .
#text=They have rows and rows of books , some are old , and some are very new .
#text=I wanted to get a new book that my favorite author had written not too long ago .
#text=I was hoping that they would have it , but it was possible it was on loan to another library patron .
#text=The books in our library are arranged by the author 's last name , so I went to the row of books that matches the authors name .
#text=I found a large section that had many of my favorite author 's books .
#text=I looked carefully for the book I was searching for , and was very excited that it was there on the shelf .
#text=I was very happy that it was not already checked out .
#text=I took the book off the shelf , and looked for a while more to see if there were any other books that I wanted to read .
#text=I found one more book that looked really interesting , so I took that one off the shelf as well .
#text=When I was done with my search , I brought my two books to the front desk .
#text=The librarian was there to help me check the books out .
#text=She said hello and asked for my library card .
#text=I handed that to her , and she took the cards out of the back of the books I wanted to check out .
#text=She made a stamp in the back of each book , letting me know what day the books were due back to the library .
#text=I said thank you to the librarian , and she handed me back my library card and the books .
#text=I could n't wait to get home and start reading .
